meanings.definition: The quality or state of being on the edge or periphery of a group or society.
meanings.sent1: Living in marginality can sometimes lead to feelings of isolation.
meanings.sent2: People on the marginality of society may face unique challenges.
meanings.sent3: The party clown found himself in marginality when no one laughed at his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas existed on the marginality of acceptance, pushing boundaries.
meanings.sent5: The dimly lit alley represented the marginality of the bustling city life.

meanings.definition: The condition of being minimal or insignificant in amount or degree.
meanings.sent1: The marginality of his contribution to the project was evident.
meanings.sent2: In a sea of colors, her dress's marginality made it stand out.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant felt a sense of marginality among the giant beetles.
meanings.sent4: His voice, though soft, carried a weight that defied its marginality.
meanings.sent5: The single flower in the vast field highlighted its marginality beautifully.
